heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 29 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.6°C), outside temperature (down 3.1°C), and inside temperature (down 1.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 4.1°C), feels like temperature (up 5.2°C), cloud levels (up 225 m), and outside temperature (up 4.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 49.3m lower than yesterday, 140.9m lower than the past week, 224.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 869m minimum and 1350m maximum, with an average of 1051.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1192.1m and 1275.8m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and bright intervals likely. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
